intro: Agalinis genistifolia, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Agalinis genistifolia is considered a short-lived perennial and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
